file_content.text: Finally, real civilization. Come on, I'll show you the sights.
Careful, little Sith. This would be an easy place to let your guard down. I cannot vouch for your safety if you do.
You ever been to Nar Shaddaa? I can show you the cantinas, get you into the best fights, tour the organ markets... it'll be fun.

Looks like they added more lights to hide the grime. Don't be fooled by the glamour; when you come to Nar Shaddaa, you're here to lose something. Money, morals, a past. Anything can fall through the cracks.
Did I ever mention I have a fear of dying before I make a million credits?
So much flesh. Are you sure I can't have a taste?
Hey, ugly! Pay you twenty credits to lick my feet.... He'll go for it. Spot me twenty credits?
The Promenade's as close to legitimate as Nar Shaddaa gets. All the families in the Hutt Cartel contribute a cut of their best enforcers to keep the peace.
This place always makes me feel dirty.... Let me borrow some credits?
Drink and play, little Sith. I want you sated when I kill you.
No weapons allowed, but I bit a guy's ear off here, once. Security bootlegged the footage. Not a big fan of casinos.
You know, I've never actually been inside one of these casinos. I was just a kid when Braden pulled me out of here, and I haven't been back since.
Keep your hands on your credits. This is not the most respectable part of town.
The lowest of the low. No one will notice if I consume one or two.
You can smell the desperation on these guys. It's like a Duros pheromone.
Watch it around here. Nar Shaddaa may be Hutt territory, but it's a big place; they can't control every corner. I'm sure someone thinks this is their turf.
Anybody need some gadgets? Maybe I can finally get that lekku buffer I've always wanted.
The night is a shadow-killer's ally.
You want to buy me a droid? Guy tried to impress me, got me a serving unit once--took me about twelve hours before I smashed it for parts. Kind of fun.
We're heading into the Corellian Sector, big tech industry hub. I used to spend a lot of time here checking out all the latest and greatest gadgets, before someone'd chase me off anyway.
I like science. Would have been my favorite subject in school. You know, if someone had let me go to school.
Enough of labs. We were born for conquest.
Didn't grow up with a lot of fancy tech. Don't really trust it. Place can burn for all I care.
There's something going on down here. Not sure what exactly, but it's definitely off the grid.
Now leaving comfort zone--please check your sense of security at the door.
The brain of the mechanical planet.
Rumor is, all this hardware runs straight into the moon's core--Nar Shaddaa's one giant computer. Don't know if it's true.
I get the feeling this is some kind of boundary. We're on our own outside of here.
I don't recognize any of these droid parts.
Only cowards let droids do their fighting for them.
More droids than people on Nar Shaddaa. Kind of creeps me out.
This is some pretty impressive equipment. Bet they're building some serious droids here.
Took a ride in one of those Mon Cal ships once--not as fast as they look.
We should seize this place and build a fleet to overrun the galaxy.
Nice ships. You help me steal one of those, I'm yours for life.
I used to love watching ships get put together. It was nice to pretend when one was finished, it'd take me away from here.
Spent a lot of time here back in the day. But the back alleys change daily. It's all different now.
Be careful, little Sith. They are small creatures, but they sting.
Bunch of losers. Come on--bet I can shoot more of them than you.
See that ugly-looking fixture over there? Rumor has it the Hutts hide bodies that need to vanish in art like that.
Nar Shaddaa = rich + filthy // Jedi = hold onto credits
I can translate the signs here. They all say "Welcome to Nar Shaddaa. Give us your credits."
Nar Shaddaa. Light and color, covering rot.
Nar Shaddaa sure is colorful. I can see why Risha likes this place. Not exactly my speed, though.
From here, you could almost forget just how scummy and dangerous this place really is.
Sith + Imperials = welcome on Promenade // Nar Shaddaa = lacks good taste
This is neutral territory for Republic and Empire. No fighting allowed--or so they say.
Hunt and killing is forbidden on Promenade. Shame.
Rubbing elbows with the enemy and playing nice doesn't sit right with me. We should be kicking the Empire's tail off the Promenade.
I've heard you can find just about anything on Nar Shaddaa. If it's illegal somewhere else, it's a bargain here.
Market goods = illegal + expensive
This is where all the bargain shoppers come. I wouldn't inspect the merchandise too closely.
Can find anything on Nar Shaddaa. Save honor.
Keep one hand on your credits and the other on your blaster. This place looks rough.
More markets. Everyone on this planet is looking to make some credits.
Area = extremely hostile
I get the strangest feeling we're not welcome here. Might be all the Kintan Kings gangsters.
Soft things here trade strength for safety.
At least we don't have to feel bad about shooting anybody here. The Kintan Kings don't seem interested in playing nice.
All of these tall buildings would make perfect sniper nests. Let's hope nobody else has thought of that.
High amount of electronic interference = jamming T7's sensors
At least it's a pretty place for a shoot-out. Lots of flashing lights and colors while people get killed....
Too much brightness and moving.
I don't know what most of those light-up signs are saying, but I bet they're not friendly.
The best place to find the newest tech in the galaxy--or at least the most convincing knockoffs.
Nar Shaddaa Red Light Sector = bad reputation // Criminals = everywhere
I hear this is where you can buy all the best technology. Some of it's even legal.
Apologize if others stare at me, Herald.
Folks are having all sorts of tech implanted in them here. Call me crazy, but I like to put my blaster down once in a while....
This place is starting to hurt my eyes. Do they have to have those holo-ads every few meters?
Organics in casino = displaying erratic behavior
Nobody does casinos quite like Nar Shaddaa. They can't afford to.
Soft things stare at bright colors. Ignore stars above.
I once knew a guy who bought two extra sets of eyes here. One for the back of his head, and the other implanted someplace ridiculous.
Club Vertica. The fastest place in the galaxy to lose every credit you have.
Imperial neural agonizer arrays = must be destroyed!
I'm in the mood for some property damage. This Imperial interrogation facility might be just the thing.
Here is the Empire's true face.
Stinking Imperials and their torture centers. Let's bust up this place!
We're going to make sure the Imps can't torture anyone in this place ever again.
Shadow Town = Imperial-controlled // Enemies = surrounding Jedi + T7
For a place called Shadow Town, it's surprisingly well lit. Maybe the name refers to the residents.
No good deaths here.
I don't figure there's anything about this Shadow Town worth saving. Maybe we should torch the whole place on our way out....
So this is Shadow Town. I always thought this place was just a rumor.
Sewage facility = highly toxic // Jedi = had all inoculations?
If you think this sewage dump is bad, the real trouble's waiting on the other side.
Fagh! Cannot smell this? Sickens.
Don't know why they bother putting sewer pipes down here. Not like the residents care about disposing of their filth.
I have definitely never smelled anything worse than this.
Speculation: I believe I was originally designed and constructed on Nar Shaddaa, master. This is the Maker's workshop.
Calculation: At least thirty percent of the population here consists of undesirables who should be liquidated.
Presentation: Observe, master--organics with poor math skills and too many credits.
Warning: HoloNet records indicate high levels of criminal activity here. Be cautious.
Request: When we are finished with liquidations, may we come back and shop for upgrades?
Reverie: There is a high probability I was designed in this very sector, master. What a thrill to come home.
Declaration: We are departing Imperial-controlled territory and entering a hostile zone. My processor just skipped a beat.
Conjecture: I wonder if I was constructed here. Are you there, Maker? It's your favorite creation, HK-51!
Revelation: I have always wanted my own starship. If I serve you well, please remember that.
Prediction: If I were capable of appreciating aesthetics, Nar Shaddaa's undesirables would very likely offend me.
Trivia: All the best droids are designed and manufactured on Nar Shaddaa--including me.
Alert: We are surrounded by Imperial troublemakers. However, the Hutts have forbidden deletions here.
Advice: Avoid purchasing any goods here, master. My scanners indicate they are inferior quality.
Declaration: Troublemakers ahead. Minor criminals, but worthy of deletion all the same.
Perplexity: The overabundance of electronic signals is jamming my sensors. Targeting restricted to line of sight.
Explanation: I believe this Red Light Sector is more commonly referred to as a "buyer beware" commercial zone.
Analysis: Detecting high levels of hormones, organic sweat and desperation.
Rejection: The Empire loves its interrogation centers, but I find them inefficient and gaudy.
Approval: It appears the Empire has perfected organic retraining bolts. Cranial explosives... what a brilliant idea.
Announcement: I believe this is what organics refer to as an open sewer. Interesting.
